intro: Chrysochlamys guatemaltecana, commonly known as the Guatemalan golden chrysochlamys, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its ornamental value. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, contributing to its aesthetic appeal. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, humid environments.
